website_summaries.verdict: Though it doesn't have any bells and whistles, it's a solid rake that does what a rake should do.
pros: A basic rake with features that fit most users' needs
It's sturdy with a wooden handle, 19-inch steel tine head, lightweight build, and reasonable price
cons: The handle is only 48 inches in length, which may be too short for taller individuals

customer_reviews.title: Great quality...excellent rake!
customer_reviews.text: I had a rake just like this one for at least 20 years. It finally Broke at the place where it is welded just from years of use and rust But, 20 years is a lot of raking! It is an excellent quality rake. That’s why I bought one again!
customer_reviews.author: newport

customer_reviews.title: a great product
customer_reviews.text: perfect size, light weight, sturdy. Have only had it long so cant rate durability but looks & feels great. should be durable
customer_reviews.author: Dolores A Wiley

customer_reviews.title: Great RAKE!
customer_reviews.text: Bought many at home depot but the metal always seems to snap at the ends. This metal forks on this rake hasn't snapped yet. Used quite heavily for commercial landscaping business. Maybe Im crazy but we have bought many from home depot and none of those ever lasted as long as this one has.
customer_reviews.author: HiSunShiNe

customer_reviews.title: Flex are the best!
customer_reviews.text: Great price for a hard working tool. I work at a zoo and get about 4 rakes a year. If you get plastic it always breaks. These do well longer than the rest. I always rinses it off after I clean out the urine areas and this rake leaves great rake lines, the key to a clean animal yard!
customer_reviews.author: kmbrook

customer_reviews.title: Flex rake product review
customer_reviews.text: Best rake in the universe, I have been using them for fifty years.
customer_reviews.author: Brendan O'Brien

customer_reviews.title: decent rake
customer_reviews.text: Good rake. Seems sturdy so it should last. Its not adjustable but works for most areas. Around trees where there are large roots it won't get many leaves. Its only good for level ground because of the lenght.
customer_reviews.author: RB

customer_reviews.title: Rated as adequate...decent buy.
customer_reviews.text: It is adequate and I would buy it again. Nothing special, but good for the price. Since it is new to us I cannot speak about its lifepan before failing.
customer_reviews.author: Sam Fadala

customer_reviews.title: Great tool
customer_reviews.text: If used correctly....its half rake and half broom....excellent garden tool.
customer_reviews.author: Todd from Tacoma

customer_reviews.title: Allonepeople. Spread love. Ignore the hate mongers (AKA governemt)
customer_reviews.text: This is the best rake by any standards. It is even better after a fair amount of use, once it's broken in. The only exceptions are: raking leaves on a lawn, in which case you need one of those big ass plastic lawn rakes; or if you're in a tight space where this one does not fit. Home Depot rakes are far too stiff which makes them skip along the ground as you try to rake.
customer_reviews.author: Californiadeep

customer_reviews.title: Great rake
customer_reviews.text: Excellent rake. I noticed that landscapers I hired used this type of rake, so I decided to try it. It picks up fairly heavy objects (chunks of wood, small rocks) but sill rakes the finer stuff - and you can move a pretty heavy load to make a pile of varied materials, not just dry leaves.
customer_reviews.author: Valerie Wilson

product_meta.title: Flexrake 1W Lawn Rake 19-Inch Steel Head with 48-Inch Wood Handle
product_meta.description: Flex rake Flex-Steel Lawn Rake Head With 48 Inch Wood Handle 19in To create the healthiest environment for your lawn, your grass and soil need to breathe and receive water. Regular lawn raking will remove thatch and grass clippings that deprive your soil of oxygen and water.
feature_bullets: Flex rake Flex-Steel Lawn Rake Head With 48 Inch Wood Handle 19in To create the healthiest environment for your lawn, your grass and soil need to breathe and receive water
Regular lawn raking will remove thatch and grass clippings that deprive your soil of oxygen and water
25 Extra wide curved tines bite down through the surface to get debris from even the most dense lawns
Regular lawn raking is healthy for your grass
